title: US actress Jennifer Lawrence calls out Gaza genocide
summary: American actress Jennifer Lawrence says the situation in Gaza is “no less than a genocide”.

title: COP30 urged to link climate justice with reparations for historical crimes
summary: Letter urges UN climate meeting in Brazil to consider costs of climate crisis, colonialism, slavery.

title: US to revoke Colombian President’s visa after Gaza protest speech
summary: The US says it will revoke the visa of Colombian President Gustavo Petro, who urged US soldiers to disobey Trump.

title: LIVE: Israel launches series of early attacks on Palestinians in Gaza
summary: Family home hit in war-battered Gaza City with children among the dead and wounded.

title: North Korea’s Kim calls for sharpening of ‘nuclear shield and sword’
summary: Kim Jong Un references 'new important nuclear strategy' in high-level meeting with scientists and military officials.

title: Did restrictions on women workers hamper Afghanistan’s earthquake response?
summary: Shortage of female medical staff, aid workers created challenges. But victims say male aid givers often helped them.

title: Turkiye, group of athletes call on FIFA, UEFA to ban Israel’s football team
summary: Pressure is growing on football's governing bodies to take action against Israel's national team over the war on Gaza.

title: Venezuela Foreign Ministry warns of ‘immoral military threat’ from US
summary: Minister says US wants his country's oil and gas amid reports Washington readying to strike 'drug targets' in Venezuela.

title: US to revoke Colombian President Petro’s visa over call to ‘disobey’ Trump
summary: The Colombian leader was filmed joining thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters outside UN headquarters in New York.

title: Elon Musk, Peter Thiel, Steve Bannon among names in new Epstein documents
summary: One calendar entry, dated December 6, 2014, reads: 'Reminder: Elon Musk to island Dec. 6 (is this still happening?)'.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,311
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,311 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: UN sanctions on Iran set to return after failed delay bid
summary: All UN sanctions on Iran are set to be reimposed on Saturday after a Russian-Chinese bid to delay them failed.

title: Nucléaire iranien : l'échec de négociations entre les Européens et Téhéran
summary: Les sanctions onusiennes contre la République islamique seront formellement rétablies samedi soir, sauf coup de théâtre, après l'échec de négociations entre les Européens et Téhéran. L'Iran a de son côté rappelé samedi "pour consultations" ses ambassadeurs en France, en Allemagne et au Royaume-Uni, a rapporté la télévision d'État.

title: Nucléaire iranien : le rétablissement imminent des sanctions
summary: Siavosh Ghazi, notre correspondant à Téhéran, décrypte la situation.

title: "Finir le travail" à Gaza : le discours offensif de Netanyahu à l'ONU
summary: La création d'un État palestinien constituerait un "suicide national" pour Israël, a déclaré vendredi à la tribune de l'ONU le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, promettant de "finir le travail" contre le Hamas à Gaza.

title: Reconnaissance de la Palestine : confusion et erreurs autour des consulats britannique et français
summary: Après leur reconnaissance d’un État palestienien, la France et le Royaume-Uni sont accusés d'avoir indiqué que leurs consulats généraux à Jérusalem étaient désormais situés en Palestine. Mais le consulat britannique est bien situé à Jérusalem-Est, considéré comme territoire palestinien occupé selon les Nations unies. Côté français, il s'agit d'une erreur du site de la Commission européenne, modifiée depuis.

title: Un accord russo-iranien à 25 milliards de dollars signé pour construire quatre centrales en Iran
summary: L’Iran et la Russie ont conclu un contrat de 25 milliards de dollars pour la construction de quatre centrales nucléaires dans la province du Hormozgan, au sud de l’Iran, a annoncé la télévision d’État iranienne vendredi. L'accord intervient dans un contexte de tensions internationales autour du programme nucléaire iranien, Téhéran insistant sur son droit au développement du nucléaire à des fins civiles.

title: Un État palestinien serait un "suicide national" pour Israël, affirme Netanyahu à l'ONU
summary: La création d'un État palestinien constituerait un "suicide national" pour Israël, a déclaré vendredi à la tribune de l'ONU le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, promettant de "finir le travail" contre le Hamas à Gaza.

title: Le jihadiste français du groupe État islamique Adrien Guihal sera jugé en Irak
summary: Le jihadiste français Adrien Guihal, qui avait revendiqué au nom du groupe État islamique l'attentat meurtrier de Nice le 14 juillet 2016, sera jugé en Irak, tout comme 46 autres ressortissants français récemment transférés de Syrie, a annoncé jeudi une source irakienne proche de l'enquête.

title: Donald Trump assure qu'il ne laissera pas Israël annexer la Cisjordanie
summary: À la veille d'un discours attendu du Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu à la tribune de l'ONU, le président américain Donald Trump a promis jeudi qu'il ne laisserait pas Israël annexer la Cisjordanie.

title: Syrie : à l'ONU, al-Charaa promet de poursuivre tous ceux "impliqués dans le bain de sang"
summary: Le nouveau président syrien, Ahmad al-Charaa, a promis, mercredi, à l'ONU, d'éradiquer le sectarisme dans son pays et de traduire en justice toutes les personnes "impliquées dans le bain de sang" que subit la Syrie.

title: Israël : la cité balnéaire d'Eilat touchée par un drone tiré du Yémen, au moins 20 blessés
summary: Un drone tiré du Yémen a touché, mercredi en fin d'après-midi, la cité balnéaire d'Eilat, au bord de la mer Rouge, à l'extrême sud d'Israël, a annoncé l'armée, les secours faisant état d'au moins 20 blessés, dont deux grièvement.

title: Donald Trump propose un nouveau plan de paix pour Gaza aux pays de la région
summary: Donald Trump a présenté aux dirigeants de plusieurs pays du Moyen-Orient un plan de paix en 21 points pour le Proche-Orient et la bande de Gaza, a déclaré mercredi son émissaire spécial, se disant confiant en une "sorte de percée" dans les prochains jours. Pendant ce temps-là, l'armée israélienne intensifie encore son offensive, qui a fait mercredi des dizaines de morts.

title: La flottille pour Gaza dénonce une nouvelle attaque de drones au large de la Grèce
summary: La flottille humanitaire pour Gaza s'est dite ciblée dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi par une nouvelle attaque de drones alors qu'elle naviguait au sud-ouest de la Crète. L'Italie a annoncé l'envoi d'une frégate militaire pour "d'éventuelles opérations de secours".

title: Le renseignement extérieur russe prétend que les troupes de l’OTAN se préparent à envahir la Moldavie
summary: Avide de ramener Chisinau dans son orbite, le Kremlin a élaboré une vaste stratégie d’ingérence dans les élections de la petite république, prévues dimanche 28 septembre.

title: Après les Etats-Unis, la Hongrie classe à son tour le mouvement Antifa comme organisation terroriste
summary: Cette annonce survient après la signature lundi par le président américain, Donald Trump, d’un décret en ce sens, à la suite de l’assassinat du militant ultraconservateur Charlie Kirk.

title: L’Irak reprend les exportations de pétrole du Kurdistan après deux ans de blocage
summary: Le contrôle des exportations pétrolières a constitué un point de tension majeur entre Bagdad et Erbil, la capitale du Kurdistan irakien, ce qui avait mené à la fermeture, depuis 2023, d’un important oléoduc vers la Turquie.

title: Deux femmes meurent en tentant une traversée de la Manche au sud de Boulogne-sur-Mer
summary: Le drame s’est produit à hauteur des plages de Neufchâtel-Hardelot, dans le Pas-de-Calais, alors qu’une centaine de migrants tentaient de prendre la mer. Une soixantaine de personnes « seraient actuellement prises en charge par la protection civile », selon la sous-préfète de Montreuil-sur-Mer.

title: Les Etats-Unis révoquent le visa du président colombien, Gustavo Petro, accusé d’actions « incendiaires »
summary: Le dirigeant de gauche, qui se trouvait à New York pour l’Assemblée générale des Nations unies, a participé, vendredi, à une manifestation propalestinienne dans la ville.

title: Etats-Unis : en quoi consiste la bataille du découpage électoral ? Comprendre en trois minutes
summary: Alors que les midterms, les élections de mi-mandat au Sénat et à la Chambre des représentants des Etats-Unis sont prévues pour 2026, les républicains et les démocrates sont déjà lancés dans une bataille du redécoupage des circonscriptions afin de faire pencher la balance de leur côté.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : le quotidien sous terre des habitants de Kherson menacés par les drones russes
summary: La photographe Virginie Nguyen Hoang a saisi pour « Le Monde » le quotidien des habitants de Kherson, qui vivent sous la menace de « safari humain », véritable chasse à l’homme par les drones russes. Sans possibilité de quitter la ville, ils survivent dans des sous-sols aménagés.

title: Comment le « ressentiment blanc » s’est nourri des politiques américaines antidiscrimination
summary: A peine de retour au pouvoir, Donald Trump a supprimé les mesures en faveur de la diversité, de l’égalité et de l’inclusion (DEI), selon lui discriminatoires envers les hommes blancs. Une rupture brutale dans l’histoire des droits civiques.

title: En Cisjordanie, le village des Américains oubliés de la Palestine
summary: En Cisjordanie occupée, Turmus Ayya est peuplé à 85 % de citoyens américano-palestiniens. Chaque été, ces binationaux viennent retrouver leur famille et entretenir le lien avec leur terre d’origine. Ils constatent alors que leur passeport américain n’offre aucune immunité contre les persécutions de l’armée et des colons sur ce territoire où les implantations israéliennes illégales s’accélèrent.

title: A Damas, une plongée en 3D dans l’enfer carcéral du régime d’Al-Assad
summary: Amer Matar, un journaliste syrien qui a été détenu au début de la révolution, a créé un musée virtuel, qui permet aux visiteurs de s’immerger dans ce que fut la prison de Saydnaya, haut lieu de la torture, situé au nord de Damas.

title: Aux Philippines, la tempête Bualoi a fait 11 morts, selon un nouveau bilan
summary: Quatorze personnes restent portées disparues dans le centre du pays, selon les autorités. Bualoi poursuit sa route et doit atteindre la côte centrale du Vietnam, dimanche.

title: Antoine Bouët, économiste : « L’Europe a-t-elle capitulé face à Donald Trump ? »
summary: Le directeur du Centre d’études prospectives et d’informations internationales rappelle, dans une tribune au « Monde », que, dans un conflit commercial, le vainqueur n’est pas celui qui augmente le plus ses droits de douane.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The Palestinian health ministry in Gaza said on Friday that the official death toll from Israel’s genocide in Gaza has climbed to 65,549 since 7 October 2023. The ministry added that at least 167,518 people have been wounded during the same period.

  • Hospitals in Gaza report that at least 60 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli attacks since dawn, amid ongoing airstrikes and house demolitions.

  • ​​Doctors at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital told Al Jazeera Arabic that a 17-year-old Palestinian boy has died of starvation in the Gaza Strip.

  • The UN agency for Palestinian refugees (Unrwa) says one in three children in Gaza went without food in the past 24 hours due to severe shortages caused by Israel’s blockade.

  • UN rights chief Volker Turk has condemned Israel’s actions in Gaza and the occupied West Bank as “absolutely horrific”, describing them as a relentless cycle of war crimes and crimes against humanity.

  • Speaking at the UN General Assembly, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that he is “not done yet” with Israel’s ongoing genocidal war on Gaza.

  • A group of 48 athletes, including France’s World Cup winner Paul Pogba and England cricketer Moeen Ali, have signed a statement demanding Israel’s suspension from international football over its assault on Palestinians in Gaza.

  • Hamas has issued a statement responding to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s address at the UN General Assembly. The group said the speech was “boycotted by the majority of delegations” and delivered by a man wanted by the International Criminal Court.

  • Israeli forces have taken control of the phones of Palestinians in Gaza to live broadcast Netanyahu’s address at the United Nations General Assembly, the Prime Minister announced on X.

  • ​The UN human rights office has named 158 companies with operations in illegal Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank. The updated database, published on Friday, added 68 firms since its last release in 2023. The list includes travel giants Airbnb, Booking.com, Expedia and TripAdvisor.

  • A Quinnipiac University poll published by Haaretz shows US support for Israel has dropped sharply amid the ongoing war in Gaza. The survey found that 47 percent of Americans believe backing Israel serves US national interests, while 41 percent disagree and 12 percent declined to answer.

  • The spokesperson for the Palestinian Border and Crossings Police Walid Ghannam stated that “thousands of citizens and travelers have been waiting since the morning for the Karama crossing to open to traffic, after it was closed by the Israeli side,”according to a Friday morning report by Wafa news agency.

  • A group of nations providing financial assistance to the Palestinian Authority has agreed to an emergency package increasing the support, Norway's foreign ministry said on Friday.

  • Saudi Arabia, Spain, Britain, Japan and France were among the nations supporting the initiative dubbed the Emergency Coalition for the Financial Sustainability of the Palestinian Authority.

  • The European Broadcasting Union (EBU), which organises the Eurovision Song Contest, said on Friday its members would vote in November on Israel's participation next year, amid calls to boycott over its genocide in Gaza.

title: Israel committing war crimes in Gaza and West Bank: UN rights chief
summary:
Israel committing war crimes in Gaza and West Bank: UN rights chief

UN rights chief Volker Turk has condemned Israel’s actions in Gaza and the occupied West Bank as “absolutely horrific”, describing them as a relentless cycle of war crimes and crimes against humanity.

Speaking at the Council on Foreign Relations, Turk dismissed suggestions that the crisis in Gaza was being ignored, stressing: “If you look at all the statements I’ve made … I speak about Gaza almost every week.”

He said the international community must take urgent steps to end the suffering, demanding an immediate ceasefire and the release of captives.

“The solution is clear: We need a ceasefire. We need the release of all hostages, and I believe we need a path for peace,” he told the gathering.

title: 'Arrest Netanyahu': Israeli PM gets a New York welcome outside the UN
summary:
'Arrest Netanyahu': Israeli PM gets a New York welcome outside the UN

As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to a half-empty room at the UN General Assembly, thousands of protesters were gathered in Times Square to condemn his presence in New York City. 

Netanyahu was issued an arrest warrant by the International Criminal Court (ICC) in November 2024, on charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity allegedly committed in Gaza since October 2023. 

All members of the ICC, which includes the United States, are legally obliged to enforce the warrants, though Hungary, an Israeli ally, has officially begun the process of withdrawal from the ICC.

The Israeli prime minister gave a combative speech to a nearly empty UN General Assembly hall on Friday, where he portrayed himself as the standard-bearer of mainstream Israel in rejecting the creation of a Palestinian state and denouncing Israel's genocide in Gaza as “a joke”.

As Netanyahu’s speech began, dozens of world leaders and diplomats walked out of the assembly hall in protest, even as US diplomats cheered him.

Read more: 'Arrest Netanyahu': Israeli PM gets a New York welcome outside the UN

title: Pogba, Moeen Ali back Israel ban from sport over Gaza genocide
summary:
Pogba, Moeen Ali back Israel ban from sport over Gaza genocide

A group of 48 athletes, including France’s World Cup winner Paul Pogba and England cricketer Moeen Ali, have signed a statement demanding Israel’s suspension from international football over its assault on Palestinians in Gaza.

The declaration, issued under the banner Athletes 4 Peace, says: “As professional athletes of diverse backgrounds, faiths, and beliefs, we believe sport must uphold the principles of justice, fairness, and humanity.”

The athletes urged UEFA to act, calling for Israel’s immediate ban from all competitions until it respects international law and halts what they described as the killing of civilians and the deliberate starvation of Gaza’s population.

The statement also pointed to last month’s killing of Suleiman al-Obeid – widely known as the “Palestinian Pele” – who, according to the Palestine Football Association, died when Israeli forces attacked civilians waiting for food aid in southern Gaza.

title: Araghchi says inspectors in Iran as UNSC set to reimpose sanctions
summary:
Araghchi says inspectors in Iran as UNSC set to reimpose sanctions

Submitted by MEE staff on Fri, 09/26/2025 - 21:34
Iranian foreign minister seeks to head off sanctions after the UN Security Council voted to reimpose them during the UN General Assembly
Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian and UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres during the UN's General Assembly in New York on 25 September 2025 (Spencer Platt/Getty Images/AFP)
Off

The UN was set to reimpose sweeping sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme after a last-minute effort by China and Russia to delay the measure failed on Friday.

Talks between the E3 - Britain, France and Germany - and Iran have been taking place for weeks in a bid to avert the return of sanctions that will hit Iran’s oil and banking sectors, as well as impose an arms embargo on the country.

Iran is already under debilitating US sanctions, which carry international weight because the US dollar is the world’s reserve currency and the go-to medium for international commerce.

The so-called "snapback" sanctions were lifted under the defunct 2015 Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA). US President Donald Trump unilaterally withdrew from the nuclear deal in 2018.

Israel launched a surprise attack on Iran in June. Trump joined in the war, bombing three Iranian nuclear facilities in strikes he said blew Iran’s nuclear programme "up to kingdom come".

The fate of Iran’s nuclear programme, however, is far from certain. According to a July report by NBC, the US severely damaged one of Iran’s nuclear sites, but two other facilities were only degraded to the point that the Islamic Republic could restart uranium enrichment at them within months.

The European powers wanted Iran to provide inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) full access to all its nuclear facilities and return to compliance with the defunct JCPOA, which regulated Iran’s ability to enrich uranium and maintain centrifuges.

China and Russia attempted to head off the sanctions with a resolution that would have given Iran and European states another half year for talks, or until 18 April 2026.

Iran receives Chinese surface-to-air missile batteries after Israel ceasefire deal
Read More »

The resolution did not receive the nine votes on the 15-member Security Council it needed for passage. Nine countries voted no and two abstained.

Still, Iran appeared to be trying to head off sanctions until the last minute.

On Friday evening, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said inspectors from the UN nuclear watchdog are "now in Iran", contradicting a claim by France that they were not present.

IAEA "inspectors are right now in Iran doing their job",  Araghchi said.

"I signed an agreement with the agency in Cairo and the director general of the agency is quite satisfied and happy."

Araghchi called the impending reimposition of nuclear sanctions "legally void", and asked the UN secretary general to prevent attempts to enact them. 

Earlier in the day, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called on the UN to reimpose sanctions.

US and Iran 'talking' 

Trump envoy Steve Witkofff said on the sidelines of the UN that the Trump administration was "talking to them [Iran]".

"Why wouldn't we? We talk to everybody. As well we should. That's the job. Our job is to solve things," he said.

When asked about the snapback sanctions, Witkoff said, "we have no desire to hurt them. We have a desire, however, to either realise a permanent solution and negotiate around snapbacks," adding, "If we can't, then snapbacks will be what they are. They're the right medicine."

Addressing the UN General Assembly this week, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said that Iran will never seek to build a nuclear bomb. Pezeshkian also showed pictures of people killed in the 12-day Israeli war on Iran, which Tehran says killed more than 1,000 people.

Some analysts noted that the E3’s decision to reimpose snapback sanctions was more about Europe preserving good ties with the US than taking on Iran, particularly as Trump shifts his tone of support to Ukraine amid its war with Russia.

"The E3 is not taking its cues from the EU, but from the White House. And its calculations have more to do with Ukraine and the transatlantic relationship than the nuclear file," Trita Parsi, the executive vice president of the Quincy Institute, wrote on X.

Iran nuclear

title: Palestinian doctor in Israeli custody faces life-threatening neglect
summary:
Palestinian doctor in Israeli custody faces life-threatening neglect

The Palestinian Prisoners’ Media Office has reported that Dr Hussam Abu Safiya, the head of Kamal Adwan Hospital in northern Gaza, has lost 25kg since his arrest and is now battling heart disease, high blood pressure and scabies due to what it described as deliberate medical neglect by Israeli authorities.

Abu Safiya, 64, was seized by Israeli forces last December while he was treating the wounded inside the hospital. He has been held without charge or trial for nearly a year, part of what rights groups call Israel’s wider assault on Palestinian health workers.

His wife has appealed for urgent international intervention to save his life, saying: “His only crime was saving the wounded.”

title: 'Arrest Netanyahu': Israeli PM gets a New York welcome outside the UN
summary:
'Arrest Netanyahu': Israeli PM gets a New York welcome outside the UN

Submitted by Maysa Mustafa on Fri, 09/26/2025 - 21:15
Protesters said the Israeli prime minister should be in the Hague, not New York City
Thousands attended the "Arrest Netanyahu" protest in New York, condemning his presence at the UN despite the ICC's warrant for his arrest, on 26 September (Maysa Mustafa)
Off

As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to a half-empty room at the UN General Assembly, thousands of protesters were gathered in Times Square to condemn his presence in New York City. 

Netanyahu was issued an arrest warrant by the International Criminal Court (ICC) in November 2024, on charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity allegedly committed in Gaza since October 2023. 

All members of the ICC, which includes the United States, are legally obliged to enforce the warrants, though Hungary, an Israeli ally, has officially begun the process of withdrawal from the ICC.

The Israeli prime minister gave a combative speech to a nearly empty UN General Assembly hall on Friday, where he portrayed himself as the standard-bearer of mainstream Israel in rejecting the creation of a Palestinian state and denouncing Israel's genocide in Gaza as “a joke”.

As Netanyahu’s speech began, dozens of world leaders and diplomats walked out of the assembly hall in protest, even as US diplomats cheered him.

Outside of the UN headquarters, protesters from across the US gathered to be a part of a march organised by several local activist groups, like the Palestinian Youth Movement and American Muslims for Palestine.

Towards the end of the "Arrest Netanyahu" protest, Colombian President Gustavo Petro and English musician Roger Waters joined in on the protest. 

The last time Netanyahu was in New York, in September of last year, he reportedly approved the pager attacks in Lebanon from his hotel in Manhattan. Dozens of Lebanese were killed, and over 3,000 were injured. 

Middle East Eye talked to protesters about their reasons for showing up to Times Square on Friday morning, and their message to Netanyahu - who was just across the street at the UN from their ending point at Dag Hammarskjold Plaza. 

 
 
 
 
View this post on Instagram
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

A post shared by Palestinian Youth Movement (@palestinianyouthmovement)

“It is enraging that Senator Schumer and Senator Gillibrand have been standing next to Bibi Netanyahu in photos when we are watching this man annihilate children,” Dr Jane Anders from Doctors Against Genocide (DAG) told MEE.

“I don't know how many more videos and pictures I can see of the corpses, of the organs hanging out of children, of the lack of health care, the abject torture that is happening right now. Refusing water, refusing to allow baby formula. This is criminal, and as human beings, this is offensive to our humanity.”

Dr Fatima from DAG said that Netanyahu doesn’t belong in New York, “he belongs in the Hague”. 

Solidarity through diversity

Many of the protesters present were Jewish. Irene, who was wearing a “Not in our name” t-shirt, said that she was sick of having her identity used by Israeli figures like Netanyahu to commit genocide.

A representative from the Orthodox community, Rabbi David, was also clear in separating the identities of Zionism and Judaism, and said Netanyahu was putting both Palestinians and Jewish people in danger. 

“[Netanyahu] should step out of his office,” he said. “He should stop the State of Israel. He should stop this occupation in its entirety, not only, not only this genocide, but this occupation altogether. This criminal is dangerous and catastrophic, not only to Palestinians, but the Jewish people as well. He is not here for the safety of the people he claims to represent. He is here for a political movement which is destroying and killing everyone along the way.”

For David Galaraza, his identity as a Puerto Rican is the foundation of his solidarity with Palestine. 

“We know what it's like to be colonised too,” he said. “If we don't stop this occupation, and we don't liberate Palestine today, what does it say about what can happen to Puerto Rico tomorrow?” 

He added that, to him, Netanyahu is “epitome - the incarnation - of Satan”. He said that he is gravely disappointed in his state officials for allowing him into the city, and hopes that a new politician can step in and stand guard when it comes to Israel - like Democratic mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani, who has repeatedly said he would arrest Netanyahu as mayor if the prime minister would visit. 

“It's disgusting that he can step foot in New York and not get arrested,” Galaraza said, “which is why we will support any candidate who will have the guts to be righteous and arrest Netanyahu. All nations in the world must make sure that they put the cuffs on him. Throw him in jail for eternity.” 

Juhyun Park, a representative from Korean activist group Nodutdol, also aimed his message at UN member states, saying that there is an obvious “deep crisis” if Israel is still allowed into the General Assembly after having a warrant out for his arrest from the ICC.

Netanyahu says all Israelis reject Palestinian state, denounces Gaza genocide as 'blood libel'
Read More »

“I think that what we are seeing is that the US today is a rogue actor on the world stage, along with the State of Israel, which is simply its proxy,” Park said.

“So the fact that they are in the UN right now demonstrates that there is a deep crisis going on in that body, a deep crisis in the UN that needs to be resolved through the action, the principled action of governments - not only against the genocide, but to ensure that the UN and any kind of multilateral bodies are truly representative of the will of humanity.”

Another New Yorker, Luis Gonzalez, echoed Galaraza’s support for Mamdani, and pointed to the mayoral candidate as one of the reasons that he participated in Friday’s protest against Netanyahu. Now, he says, he feels “awake”. 

For Gonzalez, his message to Netanyahu was clear: “I hope you rot in prison for the rest of your life.”

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: One in three Gaza children went hungry in 24 hours: UN
summary:
One in three Gaza children went hungry in 24 hours: UN

The UN agency for Palestinian refugees (Unrwa) says one in three children in Gaza went without food in the past 24 hours due to severe shortages caused by Israel’s blockade.

Citing an assessment by the International Rescue Committee, Unrwa described the situation for children as “unbearable”, with many forced into child labour or begging to survive.

The agency renewed its call for an immediate ceasefire.

title: UN General Assembly 2025: Pakistan, Bangladesh specify 'pre-1967' borders for Palestine
summary:
UN General Assembly 2025: Pakistan, Bangladesh specify 'pre-1967' borders for Palestine

With Palestinian statehood at the centre of this year's high-level week at the UN, Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif was among the first to specify that Palestine should be recognised by the international community along no less than its "pre-1967 borders, and al-Quds al-Sharif as its capital". 

Those borders refer to the areas Israel captured in the 1967 war with Arab states: the since-occupied West Bank, as well as Gaza. The UN considers Israeli outposts there illegal, according to Security Council Resolution 446. 

Sharif also did not indicate that it should only be East Jerusalem that is the Palestinian capital, as much of the international community and pre-2017 US administrations had dictated, only al-Quds, meaning Jerusalem. 

Read more : UN General Assembly 2025: Pakistan, Bangladesh specify 'pre-1967' borders for Palestine

title: Gaza hospitals report at least 60 killed amid Israeli strikes
summary:
Gaza hospitals report at least 60 killed amid Israeli strikes

Hospitals in Gaza report that at least 60 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli attacks since dawn, amid ongoing airstrikes and house demolitions.

Medical sources said 13 of those killed were shot while attempting to collect aid in the central and southern parts of the strip.

title: US support for Israel drops amid Gaza war, poll shows
summary:
US support for Israel drops amid Gaza war, poll shows

A Quinnipiac University poll published by Haaretz shows US support for Israel has dropped sharply amid the ongoing war in Gaza.

The survey found that 47 percent of Americans believe backing Israel serves US national interests, while 41 percent disagree and 12 percent declined to answer.

The figures mark a dramatic shift from December 2023, when 69 percent supported Israel and only 23 percent opposed it.

title: Israeli forces kill at least 58 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn, medics say
summary:
Israeli forces kill at least 58 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn, medics say

Hospitals in Gaza say at least 58 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli attacks since dawn today.

Medical staff reported that 12 of those killed were shot while trying to collect aid in the central and southern parts of the strip.

title: Jennifer Lawrence condemns Gaza ‘genocide’ at Spain’s San Sebastian film festival
summary:
